-- Generated by Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler 4.1.1.888
--   at:        2022-12-03 20:23:25 PKT
--   site:      Oracle Database 11g
--   type:      Oracle Database 11g




CREATE TABLE bmiHistory
  (
    id_2     INTEGER ,
    bmi      INTEGER ,
    TIME     DATE ,
    users_id INTEGER NOT NULL
  ) ;


CREATE TABLE disease
  (
    id_2       INTEGER ,
    prediciton VARCHAR2 (120) ,
    "date"     DATE ,
    users_id   INTEGER NOT NULL
  ) ;


CREATE TABLE diseaseHistory
  (
    id                 INTEGER ,
    weight             INTEGER ,
    height             INTEGER ,
    age                INTEGER ,
    sex                VARCHAR2 (15) ,
    TIME               DATE ,
    patient_patient_ID NUMBER NOT NULL
  ) ;


CREATE TABLE doctorInfo
  (
    about CLOB ,
    address CLOB ,
    days       VARCHAR2 (30) ,
    hours      VARCHAR2 (30) ,
    contact    VARCHAR2 (15) ,
    email      VARCHAR2 (30) ,
    category   VARCHAR2 (30) ,
    doctors_id INTEGER NOT NULL ,
    id         INTEGER
  ) ;
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX doctorInfo__IDX ON doctorInfo
  (
    doctors_id ASC
  )
  ;


CREATE TABLE doctors
  (
    id          INTEGER NOT NULL ,
    name        VARCHAR2 (20) ,
    designation VARCHAR2 (30) ,
    description CLOB
  ) ;
ALTER TABLE doctors ADD CONSTRAINT doctors_PK PRIMARY KEY ( id ) ;


CREATE TABLE patient
  (
    id         INTEGER ,
    weight     INTEGER ,
    height     INTEGER ,
    age        INTEGER ,
    sex        VARCHAR2 (15) ,
    users_id   INTEGER NOT NULL ,
    patient_ID NUMBER NOT NULL
  ) ;
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX patient__IDX ON patient
  (
    users_id ASC
  )
  ;
ALTER TABLE patient ADD CONSTRAINT patient_PK PRIMARY KEY ( patient_ID ) ;


CREATE TABLE users
  (
    id    INTEGER NOT NULL ,
    email VARCHAR2 (100) ,
    name  VARCHAR2 (100) ,
    password CLOB
  ) ;
ALTER TABLE users ADD CONSTRAINT users_PK PRIMARY KEY ( id ) ;


ALTER TABLE bmiHistory ADD CONSTRAINT bmiHistory_users_FK FOREIGN KEY ( users_id ) REFERENCES users ( id ) ;

ALTER TABLE diseaseHistory ADD CONSTRAINT diseaseHistory_patient_FK FOREIGN KEY ( patient_patient_ID ) REFERENCES patient ( patient_ID ) ;

ALTER TABLE disease ADD CONSTRAINT disease_users_FK FOREIGN KEY ( users_id ) REFERENCES users ( id ) ;

ALTER TABLE doctorInfo ADD CONSTRAINT doctorInfo_doctors_FK FOREIGN KEY ( doctors_id ) REFERENCES doctors ( id ) ;

ALTER TABLE patient ADD CONSTRAINT patient_users_FK FOREIGN KEY ( users_id ) REFERENCES users ( id ) ;

CREATE SEQUENCE patient_patient_ID_SEQ START WITH 1 NOCACHE ORDER ;
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER patient_patient_ID_TRG BEFORE
  INSERT ON patient FOR EACH ROW WHEN (NEW.patient_ID IS NULL) BEGIN :NEW.patient_ID := patient_patient_ID_SEQ.NEXTVAL;
END;
/
